Class AppointmentDatabase

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object

      Retrieves an address from the database if it already exists, OR adds a new row in the Address table in the database representing a new address if the address does not already exists and returns a new instance of the Address object.

      Allows the user to access an instance of an Address using the addressId value.

      Allows a user to find the last date and time that any one of the records of a table were updated.
      java.lang.String getUserName() 
      static AppointmentDatabase init(java.lang.String userName)
      Synchronized class constructor that ensures that only one Singleton instance of the AppointmentDatabase object is initialized with a given user name value.
      boolean removeAddress(Address address)
      Removes an address from the Address table in the database as well as removes the corresponding Address instance from the AppointmentDatabase singleton instance if and only if the address is not assigned to another customer in the customer table of the database.
      boolean removeCity(City city)
      Removes a city from the City table in the database as well as removes the corresponding City instance from the AppointmentDatabase singleton instance, if and only if the city is not assigned to another address in the address table.
      boolean removeCountry(Country country)
      Removes a country from the Country table in the database as well as removes the corresponding Country instance from the AppointmentDatabase singleton instance, if and only if the Country is not assigned to a city in the city table of the database.
      boolean removeCustomer(Customer customer)
      Removes a customer from the Customer table in the database as well as removes the corresponding Customer instance from the AppointmentDatabase singleton instance.
      void setUserName(java.lang.String userName)
      Sets the name of the user that is accessing the database.

      • getLastUpdateTimestampForTable

        public java.sql.Timestamp getLastUpdateTimestampForTable(java.lang.String tableName)
                                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Allows a user to find the last date and time that any one of the records of a table were updated. Note that if a record with the most recent lastupdate value is deleted, then the lastupdate value returned from this method will be earlier than that delete timestamp.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the String representing the table to query.
        Returns:
        a Timestamp object that represents update date and time of the row in the database that was most recently updated.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getCountryFromDB

        public Country getCountryFromDB(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves a country from the database if it already exists, OR adds the country to the database if the country does not already exist and returns the new instance of the Country object.
        Parameters:
        name - a String representing the name of the country.
        Returns:
        a Country instance representing the data passed into the method.

      • getCityFromDB

        public City getCityFromDB(java.lang.String name,
                          Country country)
        Retrieves a city from the database if it already exists, OR adds a new row in the City table in the database representing a new city if the city does not already exists and returns a new instance of the City object.
        Parameters:
        name - a String representing the name of the city to be added to the table
        country - a Country object representing the country in which the city resides
        Returns:
        a City object representing the new city.

      • getAddressFromDb

        public Address getAddressFromDb(java.lang.String address1,
                                java.lang.String address2,
                                City city,
                                java.lang.String zip,
                                java.lang.String phone)
        Retrieves an address from the database if it already exists, OR adds a new row in the Address table in the database representing a new address if the address does not already exists and returns a new instance of the Address object.
        Parameters:
        address1 - a String representing the first line of the address
        address2 - a String representing the second line of the address
        city - a City object representing the city in which the address resides
        zip - a String representing the address zip code
        phone - a String representing the phone number associated with this address
        Returns:
        an Address object representing the new address.

      • getCustomerFromDb

        public Customer getCustomerFromDb(java.lang.String customerName,
                                  Address address,
                                  java.lang.Boolean active)
        Retrieves a Customer from the database if it already exists, OR adds a new row in the Customer table in the database representing a new customer if the customer does not already exists and returns a new instance of the Customer object.
        Parameters:
        customerName - a String representing the name of the customer
        address - an Address representing the address of the customer
        active - a Boolean representing the active status of the customer, true if active and false if inactive
        Returns:
        a City object representing the new city.

      • removeCustomer

        public boolean removeCustomer(Customer customer)
        Removes a customer from the Customer table in the database as well as removes the corresponding Customer instance from the AppointmentDatabase singleton instance. Additionally, since the main structure of the database is unable to be altered, this method will then call the removeAddress function which will test to see if that address is assigned to another customer, and if not, will remove it from the database.
        Parameters:
        customer - a Customer instance representing the customer to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the customer was removed from the database, false if not

      • removeAddress

        public boolean removeAddress(Address address)
        Removes an address from the Address table in the database as well as removes the corresponding Address instance from the AppointmentDatabase singleton instance if and only if the address is not assigned to another customer in the customer table of the database. Additionally, since the main structure of the database is unable to be altered, this method will then call the removeCity function which will test to see if that city is assigned to another address, and if not, will remove it from the database.
        Parameters:
        address - an Address instance representing the address to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the address was removed from the database, false if not

      • removeCity

        public boolean removeCity(City city)
        Removes a city from the City table in the database as well as removes the corresponding City instance from the AppointmentDatabase singleton instance, if and only if the city is not assigned to another address in the address table. Additionally, since the main structure of the database is unable to be altered, this method will then call the removeCountry function which will test to see if that country is assigned to another city, and if not, will remove it from the database.
        Parameters:
        city - a City instance representing the city to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the city was removed from the database, false if not

      • removeCountry

        public boolean removeCountry(Country country)
        Removes a country from the Country table in the database as well as removes the corresponding Country instance from the AppointmentDatabase singleton instance, if and only if the Country is not assigned to a city in the city table of the database.
        Parameters:
        country - a Country instance representing the country to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the country was removed from the database, false if not
